intro: Asplenium cuneifolium subsp. dacicum, commonly known as the Dacian spleenwort, is a fern belonging to the family Aspleniaceae. It is a small, epiphytic or lithophytic plant, typically growing on rocks or tree trunks in moist, shaded environments. The plant has lance-shaped, serrated leaves that are usually dark green and densely packed. It produces spore-bearing structures called sorus, which are located on the underside of the fronds. This subspecies is native to parts of Europe and is often found in temperate forest habitats.
